title: The Communication Tax
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Communication Tax usable.

hook.text: The average worker spends 28% of their week on email and 20% searching for information. That's the communication tax.

buildup.text: Poor communication doesn't just waste time â€” it causes errors, missed deadlines, and conflict.

discovery.text: A Grammarly study found poor communication costs US businesses $1.2 trillion per year.

twist.text: The irony: we spend years learning technical skills but almost no time learning to communicate effectively.

climax.text: Clear communication is a force multiplier. One well-written message saves dozens of follow-ups.

punchline.text: Bad communication is the most expensive free thing in business.

quiz.question: How much does poor communication cost US businesses annually?
